intro: Goniothalamus macranthus var. brevipetalus, commonly known as the short-petalled goniothalamus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, with simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
